column4: hi all, I have a samsung mp3 player, but when I connect it to the USB port Ubuntu 8.10 doesnt seem to identify it and the mp3 player starts charging instead. Are there any drivers available for this mp3 player for Ubuntu OS
what do you expect? it needs to be connected to rhythmbox?
do you see it as a storage device?
no i dont see it as a storage device
i would lik to see it as a storage device to copy/paste songs
plug it in and the send the output of the following command to pastebin : dmesg | tail && lsusb
http://paste.ubuntu.com/96059/
your sure that it has real usb support?
I went to the samsung website to find suitable drivers/firmware for linux os. But they have only posted drivers for different Windows versions
this mp3 player was recognised by windows earlieronly after i had installed the specified drivers. But now i dont have a windows os. I use only linux
has the mp3 player also real name?
The real name of the player is Samsung Mp3 player ( model YPU2J)
it may work with MTP, but there appears to be a lot of issues with this device, both on Linux and on Windows
is there any other means that i can make ubuntu recognise it as a memory device. for eg: installing linux specific drivers or something of that sort?
it appears to be the MTP-route for you
what is MTP?
media transfer protocol
So do i have to install the MTP using apt command?
maybe, I'm not using MTP
Will I get any information regarding MTP in the Ubuntu wiki/forums?
http://liquidat.wordpress.com/2007/05/24/howto-samsung-yp-t9jqb-and-linux-aka-mtp-the-fourth/ <-- this may help you
Thank you.
